theory: Ivankov's presence in Impel Down was a deliberate Revolutionary Army operation to maintain a safe house within the World Government's most secure prison, allowing them to monitor and rescue valuable prisoners.
author: One Piece community (various sources)
supportingEvidence: Level 5.5 has existed for over 100 years with secret passageways to all levels above
Ivankov and Inazuma are high-ranking Revolutionary Army officers
They've been rescuing prisoners that Impel Down thinks were 'demoned away'
counterEvidence: It's unclear if Ivankov was imprisoned or voluntarily stayed in Impel Down

theory: Luffy's unconscious use of Conqueror's Haki while severely poisoned in Episode 438 demonstrates that his willpower is fundamentally stronger than any physical ailment, foreshadowing his ability to overcome seemingly impossible odds throughout the series.
author: One Piece community analysis
supportingEvidence: Luffy used Conqueror's Haki despite being poisoned and unconscious
This demonstrates that Haki is tied to fundamental willpower, not conscious control
Pattern continues with Luffy surviving impossible situations through willpower (Marineford, Whole Cake Island, Wano)

theory: The introduction of Ivankov and his hormone abilities in Episode 438 sets up the eventual revelation that he knows secrets about Luffy's father Dragon and the formation of the Revolutionary Army.
author: One Piece theorists
supportingEvidence: Ivankov is a founding member of the Revolutionary Army alongside Dragon
Ivankov knows Dragon personally and refers to him as a close friend
Ivankov's decision to help Luffy becomes connected to his relationship with Dragon
